definition: to save the nation
to save/to assist/to rescue
variant of 救[jiu4]
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of sb who ostensibly collaborated with the Japanese during the Sino-Japanese war of 1937-1945) to secretly work for the Nationalists or against the Communists

sentences.english: The fifth part, the latter Qing dynasty foreign affairs send the education to save the nation the thought appraisal.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分，晚清洋务派教育救国思想的评价。

sentences.chinese: 因而买壳上市就成为一些企业的曲线救国之路。

sentences.english: Meanwhile he devoted himself to his ideal of saving the country by enterprise and education.
sentences.chinese: 同时他又致力于实业救国和教育救国的理想。

sentences.english: Meanwhile he devoted himself to his ideal of saving the country by enterprise and education.
sentences.chinese: 同时他又致力于实业救国和教育救国的理想。

sentences.english: Mainly combed the education to save the nation the thought development vein.

sentences.english: It marks the beginning of the Chinese anti-Japanese national salvation.
sentences.chinese: 它标志着中华民族抗日救国的开端。

sentences.english: You have been learning the theory of revolution and studying the principles and methods for resisting Japan and saving the nation.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学习革命的理论，研究抗日救国的道理和方法。

sentences.english: At the same time in the national crisis, he strongly called for self-salvation.
sentences.chinese: 同时在国难当头的时候，他极力呼吁自强救国。

sentences.english: They are, by the simplest definition, the principles for our nation's salvation.
sentences.chinese: 用最简单的定义说，三民主义就是救国主义。

sentences.english: The second part explained the contents of the thought.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分阐述的是任鸿隽科学救国思想的内容。

definition: to save from extinction/to save the nation
at stake/in peril
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country

lit. rich country, strong army (idiom); slogan of legalist philosophers in pre-Han times/Make the country wealthy and the military powerful, slogan of modernizers in Qing China and Meiji Japan (Japanese pronunciation: Fukoku kyōhei)
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
to love one's country/patriotic
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People (late 1890s)
to lay down the pen and take up the sword (idiom)/to join the military (esp. of educated person)
expel the Manchu, revolutionary slogan from around 1900
constitutional government
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
